AttributeInfo.Name: Execution Server Selector
AttributeInfo.Description: This attribute points to a pre-defined group of execution servers. Usually used for different sites or domains.
Enable in order to retrieve credentials from a Windows machine. Note that if this parameter is enabled and the credentials weren't retrieved within 15 minutes the deployment will fail.
AttributeInfo.Name: Wait for Credentials

AttributeInfo.Description: If empty the role that is configured on the Execution Server instance in the Management VPC is used.
AttributeInfo.Name: AWS Secret Access Key

AttributeInfo.Description: The Management VPC ID. Will be used to configure the communication between the Management VPC and the Sandbox VPC. For example vpc-633fb904.
AttributeInfo.Name: AWS Mgmt VPC ID
VPC Mode
AttributeInfo.Description: Every sandbox with AWS apps deploys a VPC to AWS. This setting determines how the sandbox VPC will chose a CIDR block. In Dynamic Mode, the CIDR block is chosen by Cloudshell Server. In Static Mode, the CIDR block for all sandboxes allocated will be taken from VPC CIDR attribute on AWS cloud provider.

AttributeInfo.Name: VPC CIDR
AttributeInfo.Description: The CIDR used for sandbox VPC when VPC Mode is Static.

AttributeInfo.Name: Private IP
AttributeInfo.Description: When the VPC is in static mode this attribute is used to set a static private IP for the deployed app. To set static private IPs in multi subnet mode the expected value is a json string that maps the subnet request CIDR to the requested static private IP. Example: {'10.0.0.0/28': '10.0.0.6'}
If empty the role that is configured on the Execution Server instance in the Management VPC is used.
AttributeInfo.Name: AWS Access Key ID

AttributeInfo.Description: The public cloud region to be used by this cloud provider resource.
AttributeInfo.Name: Region

AttributeInfo.Description: The Management VPC's security group. Will be used to configure the communication between the Management VPC's instances and the Sandbox instances. For example sg-0d104876.
AttributeInfo.Name: AWS Mgmt SG ID

AttributeInfo.Description: The available device names for the volume. Depending on the block device driver of the selected AMI's kernel, the device may be attached with a different name than what you specify. If left empty the default defined in the AMI will be used. For example: /dev/xvda
AttributeInfo.Name: Root Volume Name

AttributeInfo.Description: The name of an S3 bucket in which PEM files will be located. Each active Sandbox will have a PEM file under a designated folder. For example: sandbox-management.
AttributeInfo.Name: Keypairs Location

AttributeInfo.Description: The root volume size. The value must be greater or equal to the size of the root snapshot used. If set to zero the default defined in the image will be used. For example: 30.
AttributeInfo.Name: Storage Size

AttributeInfo.Description: Ports, protocol and source to open inbound traffic from outside of the sandbox. The syntax is port[single/range]:protocol[tcp(default)/udp]:source[cidr] with semi-colon separation. The default source cidr, if not specified, is any (0.0.0.0/0). For example: 80;443:tcp:10.0.0.0/24;200-220:udp.
AttributeInfo.Name: Inbound Ports

AttributeInfo.Description: If set to False the deployment will not wait for the VM to get an ip
AttributeInfo.Name: Wait for IP
Wait for Status Check
AttributeInfo.Description: If enabled the app deployment will end successfully only after instance status checks has passed. The status checks include network connectivity, physical host status, system status and more.
Enables the automatic execution of the Autoload command during reservation Setup.
AttributeInfo.Name: Autoload

AttributeInfo.Description: The default number of I/O operations per second that the root volume can support. This parameter is used only for storage of type io1, in which you can provision up to 30 IOPS per GiB. If set to zero the default in the image will be used. For example: 240.
AttributeInfo.Name: Storage IOPS

AttributeInfo.Description: The type of the storage volume. In AWS there are few EBS Volume types that can be used, gp2 and io1 for SSD, st1 and sc1 for HDD or the standard type which is the old generation EBS volume type. If auto is selected the storage type defined in the image will be used.
AttributeInfo.Name: Storage Type

AttributeInfo.Description: The AWS EC2 instance type. The instance type determines the CPU, memory and networking capacity of the instance. For example: t2.large.
AttributeInfo.Name: Instance Type
IAM Role Name
AttributeInfo.Description: Provide the IAM role name to be used in this instance.

AttributeInfo.Name: Custom Tags
AttributeInfo.Description: Custom tags per EC2 instance, Comma separated values e.g: tag_name:ec2_instance,tag_name2:ec2_instance2

AttributeInfo.Name: User Data URL
AttributeInfo.Description: The URL of the user data script

AttributeInfo.Name: User Data Parameters
AttributeInfo.Description: Parameters to execute the script e.g: 'param1 param2 ' will end in running the command like this :'./file.sh param1 param2'

The max number of I/O operations per second that the volume can support. For Provisioned IOPS (SSD) volumes, you can provision up to 30 IOPS per GiB. If left empty the default in the AMI will be used. For example 240.
AttributeInfo.Name: Max Storage IOPS

AttributeInfo.Description: The max number of GiB of the root volume. Must be greater than zero or the size of the snapshot used. If kept empty the default size of the snapshot will be used. For example 8.
AttributeInfo.Name: Max Storage Size

AttributeInfo.Description: The AWS AMI ID to launch the instance from. The AMI should be accessible in the selected cloud provider's AWS region. For example :ami-6869aa05.
AttributeInfo.Name: AWS AMI Id
Allow all Sandbox Traffic
AttributeInfo.Description: Whether an app should allow inbound traffic from all other apps in the sandbox. If set to false, access from specific apps or subnets can be defined by an API call.

Reserved networks that will be excluded when allocating Sandbox networks. Should include at least the management network. The syntax is comma separated CIDRs. For example: 10.0.0.0/24, 10.1.0.0/16, 172.31.0.0/24.
AttributeInfo.Name: Networks In Use
Public IP Options
AttributeInfo.Description: Select whether to create a public IP. If the VM will be connected to more than one subnet, and public IP is required in at least one of them, the 'elastic IPs' option ought to be selected.
Reserved IP addresses are not available to use, and cannot be assigned to an instance.
AttributeInfo.Name: Reserved IPs in Subnet
Enable Source Dest Check
AttributeInfo.Description: Indicates whether source/destination checking is enabled. A value of true means checking is enabled, and false means checking is disabled. This value must be false for Virtual Appliance instances like virtual firewalls/routers

AttributeInfo.Name: Status Check Timeout
AttributeInfo.Description: Timeout in seconds for AWS status checks to pass. If set to 0 then the default timeout will be used.
